docs.snippet: Residents of Kansas, Alabama and Georgia are no longer able to register to vote using a federal form without providing proof of U.S. citizenship after a federal elections official added the requirement without public notice or review by the agency...
docs.lead_paragraph: Residents of Kansas, Alabama and Georgia are no longer able to register to vote using a federal form without providing proof of U.S. citizenship after a federal elections official added the requirement without public notice or review by the agency's commissioners.

headline.main: US Official Requires Citizenship Proof in 3 States
headline.print_headline: US Official Requires Citizenship Proof in 3 States

docs.snippet: More than two decades ago, Arkansas was among the first states to embrace the term limits movement by restricting how long lawmakers could serve in its Legislature. No one championed the movement more loudly than the state's Republicans, who saw i...
docs.lead_paragraph: More than two decades ago, Arkansas was among the first states to embrace the term limits movement by restricting how long lawmakers could serve in its Legislature. No one championed the movement more loudly than the state's Republicans, who saw it as a way to loosen the Democratic Party's generations-old grip on Arkansas' elected offices.

headline.main: Arkansas GOP, Having Embraced Term Limits, Is Now Conflicted
headline.print_headline: Arkansas GOP, Having Embraced Term Limits, Is Now Conflicted

docs.snippet: An admirer could use some reassurance....
docs.lead_paragraph: An admirer could use some reassurance.
docs.abstract: Nicholas Kristof Op-Ed column asks, from the perspective of an admirer of Sen Bernie Sanders, whether Democratic presidential candidate can actually put his ambitious ideas into practice, and whether he is genuinely electable; answers both questions skeptically.

docs.snippet: Whatever the linguistic ties between Russia and Ukraine, the words we share no longer have the same meaning....
